main event: Two meteor-type objects flashed across the sky in Tokyo, Japan, separating into two parts.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on August 1, 1952, at 23:15 Tokyo Time., Observers reported the objects as having an orange-colored body with a blue-rimmed white light., The objects were described as moving at speeds greater than conventional jet aircraft., A Japanese engineer with 15 years of civil engineering experience witnessed the event and noted that others also saw it., The weather was fair with some clouds and moderate southwest winds during the sighting.
witness description: Japanese engineer with 15 years of civil engineering experience.
